title: Increased price of mustard shifts ketchup demand

content.question: Assume that mustard and ketchup are considered substitutes by consumers. If the price of mustard increases, which of the following graphs represents the most likely response in the ketchup market?

choices.label: Two quantites appear on the horizontal axis and are labeled, from left to right, Q sub 2 and Q sub 1. Two prices appear on the vertical axis and are labeled from bottom to top, P sub 1and P sub 2. The graph has a downward sloping line from left to right, which is labeled Demand. The Demand line does not intersect the horizontal or vertical axis. There are two data points on the Demand line. The leftmost and higher data point has coordinates, Q sub 2and P sub 2. The rightmost and lower data point has coordinates, Q sub 1and  P sub 1.

Two quantities appear on the horizonatal axis and are labeled, from left to right, Q sub 1 Q sub 2. Two quantities appear on the vertical axis and are labeled from bottom to top, P sub 2  P sub 1. The graph has a downward sloping line, from left to right, which is labeled Demand. The Demand line does not intersect the horizontal or vertical axis. There are two data points on the Demand line. The leftmost and upper data point has coordinates Q sub 1 P sub 1. The rightmost and lower data point has coordinates Q sub 2 P sub 2.

The graph has 3 lines. There are two parallel downward sloping lines, from left to right, on the graph. The lower, leftmost line is labeled Demand sub 1. The upper, rightmost line is labeled Demand sub 2. There is a horizontal arrow pointing right, from the Demand sub 1 line to the Demand sub 2 line. One upward sloping line, from left to right, intersects both demand lines and is labeled Supply and there is a  data point at each point of intersection.

The graph has 3 lines. There are two parallel downward sloping lines, from left to right, on the graph. The lower, leftmost line is labeled Demand sub 2. The upper, rightmost line is labeled Demand sub 1. There is a horizontal arrow pointing left, from the Demand sub 1 line to the Demand sub 2 line. One upward sloping line, from left to right, intersects both demand lines and is labeled Supply and there is a data point at each point of intersection.

There are 3 lines on the graph.  There is a downward sloping line, from left to right, on the graph labeled Demand. There are two parallel upward sloping lines, from left to right, that are close to each other, that intersect the demand line and there is a data point at each point of intersection. The upper, leftmost line is labeled Supply sub 1 and the lower, rightmost line is labeled Supply sub 2. There is a horizontal arrow pointing right from the Supply sub 1 line to the Supply sub 2 line.

content.answer: The graph has 3 lines. There are two parallel downward sloping lines, from left to right, on the graph. The lower, leftmost line is labeled Demand sub 1. The upper, rightmost line is labeled Demand sub 2. There is a horizontal arrow pointing right, from the Demand sub 1 line to the Demand sub 2 line. One upward sloping line, from left to right, intersects both demand lines and is labeled Supply and there is a  data point at each point of intersection.

topic.text: 2.7: Market Disequilibrium and Changes in Equilibrium

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
